definition: to provoke/to irritate/to vex/to stir up/to anger/to attract (troubles)/to cause (problems)

sentences.english: Small qian to block has angered the master yoda, more is out of the clear temple.
sentences.chinese: 小倩欲阻止却惹怒了尤达大师，更被赶出导明寺。

sentences.english: We pissed our teacher off again today, horsing around and acting up.
sentences.chinese: 今天我们调皮捣蛋，又把老师给惹怒了。

sentences.english: Mary flared up  when Jim angered her.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆把玛丽惹怒了，于是她大发脾气。

sentences.english: Especially if the Chris "Birdman" Anderson tries to mess with him.
sentences.chinese: 特别是当鸟人安德森想要惹怒科比的时候。

sentences.english: e.g: The way she treats me really pisses me off.
sentences.chinese: 她那样骗我的确惹怒了我。

sentences.english: The donkey got angry and kicked that boy down.
sentences.chinese: 那拱驴被惹怒子，把那个小男孩踢倒了。

sentences.english: A soldier baited a captured enemy by laughing at him.
sentences.chinese: 一位士兵嘲笑一个俘虏来惹怒他。

sentences.english: A angered by asleep, and at night the stepmother eyes.
sentences.chinese: 一次惹怒了后娘，夜里熟睡之际被后娘挖掉了眼睛。

sentences.english: The headmaster's adult loan scores to the sea, dafu angered vice principal.
sentences.chinese: 校长大人贷款分数给海大富，惹怒了副校长。

sentences.english: I was annoyed that he had also picked up a snowball hit him to go.
sentences.chinese: 我被他惹怒了，也操起一个雪球向他砸去。

sentences.english: He suffered castration because he irritated the Emperor by defending a general.
sentences.chinese: 由于为一位大将军辩护，惹怒了皇帝，被处了官刑。

sentences.english: Mr Bao's refusal to remove a cross from his church's roof had angered the authorities.
sentences.chinese: 包国华拒绝拆除教堂屋顶上的十字架惹怒了中国官方。
他敷衍了事的回答惹怒了德尔珈朵。

sentences.english: Fearful of incurring the wrath of the males again, the females also no longer dare to go near the mucus.
sentences.chinese: 母鱼因为怕再次惹怒公鱼，便不敢再靠近黏液一步。

sentences.english: Evicting their occupants would anger the middle classes.
sentences.chinese: 驱逐他们的居住者将惹怒中产阶级。

definition: to offend sb/to make a faux pas/a faux pas/see also 得罪[de2 zui4]
to commit an offense/to violate the law/excuse me! (formal)/see also 得罪[de2 zui5]
to flip out/to act out violently
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
to provoke/to irritate/to vex/to stir up/to anger/to attract (troubles)/to cause (problems)
the masses rise to attack it (idiom); Everyone is against the idea./universally abhorrent
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to take one's anger out on sb (who does not deserve it)
